en: MANY KINDS OF PEOPLE MADE THE TRIP TO OREGON.
CHOOSE YOUR OCCUPATION TO SEE DETAILS.
WHAT ARE THE NAMES OF THE
You start with the most money but\nyour hands have never held a wrench.\nField repairs will be difficult.
Moderate funds, but you know wood\nand iron. Repairs come naturally.\nScore multiplier rewards the skill.
The least money, but you know the\nland and hard work. The highest\nscore multiplier for those who survive.
Recovered from backup. Recent progress may be lost.
Are you sure you want to delete this save?
NO AMMO. LOAD UP BEFORE HUNTING.
{0} lbs/day\nHalf health recovery\nUse when food low
{0} lbs/day\nFull health recovery\nBest for weak party

{0}, a {1}, has gathered a party of five for the 2,170 mile journey west to Oregon's Willamette Valley. The route follows the Platte River across the Great Plains, through South Pass in the Rocky Mountains, and down the Columbia River gorge to Oregon City.\n\nBefore departing, you must outfit your wagon at Matt's General Store. Choose your supplies wisely. Once you leave Independence, resupply opportunities are scarce and prices only go up.
Use + and - to adjust quantities. Your budget updates in real time.
You need at least one yoke of oxen to pull the wagon!
Early start. Cold and wet, but more time on the trail.
Good balance of weather and timing. Most popular choice.
Warm start, but you must keep pace to beat the snow.
Late start. Risk of early snow in the mountains.
Very late. Snow in the Blue Mountains is almost certain.
You need at least 1 yoke. 3 is ideal.
200 lbs per person for the journey. 1000 lbs total recommended.
At least 2 sets per person. Cold mountains ahead.
5+ boxes for hunting. More if you rely on game.
Wagon is in good condition. Repair not needed.
Tuneup active until mile {0}. Cannot stack.
YOU ENTER THE WILDERNESS. YOUR RIFLE IS READY.
WAGON IS FULL. RETURN TO CAMP.
YOU FIND A SPOT AND BAIT YOUR LINE.
NO MORE CASTS LEFT. RETURN TO CAMP.
Each role gives one party member a special bonus. A person can hold only one role.
Reduces breakdown chance by 30%. Needs to be conscious to help.
Increases meat yield by 30% on hunting trips.
Slows illness damage by 20% for the whole party.
Reduces hazard event chance by 25% per terrain warning.
YOU DECLINED THE TRADE. THE TRADER MOVED ON.
You have reached The Dalles. The overland trail ends here.\nOregon City is 270 miles ahead. You must choose your route.
YOUR WAGON IS LOADED. THE TRAIL AWAITS.\n[Press SPACE to continue]
YOU RETURNED WITH {0} LBS OF MEAT. USED {1} BULLETS.
BARLOW ROAD CHOSEN. $5 TOLL PAID. THE ROAD IS ROUGH BUT DRY.
COLUMBIA RIVER ROUTE CHOSEN. PREPARE FOR THE CROSSING AHEAD.
